info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:59PM EDT until August 01 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near East Washington, or near Washington, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Washington, California, Monongahela, Bentleyville, Wickerham Manor-Fisher, Baidland, North Charleroi, Ellsworth, Deemston, Eighty Four, Cokeburg, and Beallsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
